page.title: 15Interview - HeadTeacher
page.content: The Headteacher of the local Primary School, Mr K Bunting has been teaching for 31 years, most of this time in schools in Nottinghamshire. Mr Bunting was appointed to Misterton in 1969, three years after this appointment the school celebrated its centenary. It was a{'Board of Education'}school set up in 1872, with a clock-tower which also contained a bell.(This building is still in use today as a{community {centre}). The school is now housed in what was a Secondary school, opened in 1957. The school is unusual in that it has its own covered heated swimming pool. There are at present approximately 160 children on roll. Mr Bunting enjoys his job very much, finds the children delightful and their parents very cooperative.
